Ummm... You REALLY could have made the process SO MUCH easier...and SO MUCH MORE EFFICIENT. Why not install the copper pipe tubing inside a 55 gallon steel drum, with both ends removed and the bottom capped in steel wire meshing, and the exterior then painted with the most BLACK paint on the market?
This tiny investment in a VERY incredible SUNLIGHT-ABSORBING paint, would significantly scale down the amount of biodegradables required to achieve the same end result.
In my past, I've seen this method (55 gal steel drum) used in two ways, one method being similar to yours (but within a 55 gal steel drum) and the other, using fallen timber to burn inside the barrel, to heat a swimming pool and a hot tub. You can also run black tubing in a zig zag pattern atop your home and let the black casing of the tubing, in conjunction with the heat roof shingles absorb from sunlight, to heat circulating water within the tubing to heat your spa, hot tub or pool.

Wow

My grandparents did this when I was a kid. My grandparents owned a rantch and I would gather all of the animals waste for compost. I loved it, it smelt like fresh earth on a warm rainy day. It heated up and started fires if we didn't move the piles around. Usually we had five piles of compost. We used a real porcelain tub for a tub though. We built three hot tubs every fall. We also had an outhouse in the side of the barn. My grandparents never allowed the kids to clean it though, they were worried it would make us sick. There's one rule, never touch the outhouse except to go poo. hahaha! Everything else was okay. My grandparents didn't use wood, we would gather bricks and stones from the bonfire pit. My grandpa put copper wires on the bottom of the porcelain tub. We turned the tubs upside down when we were finishing using it. They were covered with a special blanket my grandma made for them. My friends always asked what was under the blanket. I told them it's an experiment and I would build up to a grand reveal. LOL 😂 It was fun.

하늘에 계신 우리 아버지여,
이름이 거룩히 여김을 받으시오며,
나라가 임하옵시며,
뜻이 하늘에서 이루어진것 같이 땅에서도 이루어지이다.
오늘 우리에게 일용할 양식을 주옵시고
우리가 우리에게 죄 지은 자를 사하여 준것 같이
우리 죄를 사하여 주시옵시고
우리를 시험에 들게 하지 마옵시고,
다만 악에서 구하옵소서.
나라와 권세와 영광이
아버지께 영원히 있사옵나이다.
아멘. (마태 6:9~13)

Love seeing more of this technology! Human waste fertilizers pose promise but I’m concerned about long term hormonal and pharmaceutical pollution. I worked at a composting facility down the road from a human waste spreading company and that inspired me to layout a research project on the matter that I’m hoping to start in the spring. They take the sludge from waste treatment centers and spread it on crop land and it’s becoming big business here in Illinois. Thankfully they do prescribed spreading and only once every so many years. For instance we’ve seen the processed waste water pollution impact costal areas in obscure ways making me weary of commercial scale programs until the pollution aspect is addressed. Looking forward to future generations of composting toilets and waste water treatment 🤘
